text:
Ireland's Call is the anthem for the Ireland national rugby union team. The anthem replaced "Amhrán na bhFiann" because the players had came from both Ireland and Northern Ireland.
Lyrics.
In most games today, the first part has been sung, then the chorus two times.
Come the day and come the hour
Come the power and the glory
We have come to answer our country's call
From the four proud provinces of Ireland
From the mighty glens of Antrim
From the rugged hills of Galway
From the walls of Limerick and Dublin Bay
From the four proud provinces of Ireland
Hearts of steel and heads unbowing
We will fight until we can fight no more
For the four proud provinces of Ireland
'Neath the glass sky they assemble
For the four proud provinces of Ireland
